thread.title: NHL: Oilers lose in rookie Connor McDavid's debut
thread.title_full: NHL: Oilers lose in rookie Connor McDavid's debut

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Oilers lose in rookie Connor McDavid's debut
text:
NHL: Oilers lose in rookie Connor McDavid's debut Associated Press Posted: 10/08/2015 09:37:02 PM PDT Updated: 10/08/2015 10:23:11 PM PDT thursDAY'S HIGHLIGHTS Blues 3, Oilers 1: Rookie Robby Fabbri scored the tiebreaking goal midway through the third period to help St. Louis beat Edmonton, spoiling Oilers rookie Connor McDavid's NHL debut. McDavid, the No. 1 overall pick in this year's draft, took 22 shifts, played 18:07. He had two shots on goal and struggled on faceoffs -- winning only three of 13. Fabbri, a 19-year-old forward -- and McDavid's childhood friend -- was also playing in his first NHL game. 
Stars 3, Penguins 0: Antti Niemi recorded his 33rd career shutout and assisted on two goals in his Dallas debut. Jets 6, Bruins 2: Chris Thorburn and Nicolas Petan scored in the third period after Boston came within one goal, and Winnipeg opened with a win. It was the first victory for the former Atlanta Thrashers in Boston since 2007. 
Senators 3, Sabres 1: Kyle Turris scored twice, and Ottawa won a coach's challenge to overturn a Buffalo goal in the Senators' victory. 
Predators 2, Hurricanes 1: Craig Smith had a power-play goal as Nashville scored twice in the first period to hold off Carolina. 
Lightning 3, Flyers 2: Jason Garrison scored his second goal in overtime to lift Tampa Bay past Philadelphia. 
Wild 5, Avalanche 4: Zach Parise scored three times to lift Minnesota. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
